summary:
With over 15 years of experience in the networking industry, I have a proven track record of success in various roles, from network technician to management. My expertise in the industry has been honed through my work at ISPs, Non-Profit Organisations, ICT integrator, and one of the largest IXPs in the world, where I currently hold the Manager Operations and NOC Manager roles.
I am a highly motivated and dedicated professional who is always eager to learn and grow. My colleagues would describe me as a team player, proactive, detail-oriented, knowledgeable, fast learner, and friendly with great troubleshooting and communication skills who can work effectively with diverse teams.
My management style is people-centric, friendly, and supportive, and I strongly believe in fostering a positive and productive work environment. 
I am certified in several networking technologies such as Cisco (CCNA/CCNP/CCDA/CCDP), Palo Alto (PCNSA), I have trained in various management topics, hold ITIL4 Foundation certification and I am a trained and active Jira Server administrator.

certifications.name: Business Etiquette: Meetings, Meals, and Networking Events
Disagreeing with Someone Senior to You
CCSP Cert Prep: 1 Cloud Concepts, Architecture, and Design (2019)
How to Stop Wasting Time in Meetings
Choosing a Cloud Platform for Developers: AWS, Azure, and GCP

projects.title: AMS-IX Core switch migration
projects.description:
Migration activities from two SLX9850 switches per core site to one SLX9850 per core site.
Migration plan, coordination between teams, overview and part of the network engineering team that implemented the changes.
Physical and configuration changes were completed in only three midnight maintenance windows.

projects.title: Accedian MetroNode Network Performance Element deployment sanitisation
projects.description:
Due to our ever-growing and ever-changing infrastructure, the need of the sanitisation of our Accedian MetroNode AMO-10000-NE deployment arose.
During the project almost every aspect of the implementation had to be revisited and re-thought of, from the database part (data fields and structure) to the scripts and procedures. On each device the configuration was re-generated, reviewed and finally applied while, of course, the whole process has been documented in detail.

projects.title: AMS-IX first PE switch migration from MLXe-32 to SLX-9850
projects.description:
One of the first worldwide implementations of SLX as a PE MPLS/VPLS switch on a live platform.
Planning and execution of a step-by-step procedure to replace the first AMS-IX Brocade MLXe-32 stub switch with Brocade SLX-9850 switch.

projects.title: VDX POC at Brocade's USA headquarters
projects.description: Detailed planning and testing during a POC (Proof of Concept) held at Brocade's San Jose headquarters regarding VDX switches implementation as AMS-IX management network switches, including pinpointing potential bugs and filling a number of RFEs for the VDX platform.

projects.title: Interconnecting two companies
projects.description: Interconnection of two different provider MPLS VPNs, including the necessary routing and voip configuration to connect approximately 55 stores.

projects.title: Implementation of national-wide VPN network with Video Conference capability
projects.description:
Installation and configuration of 71 remote sites to an MPLS network, 6 of which have Video Conference capability.
Installation and configuration of the Video Conference platform which included CUCM, VCS-C, EXP-C, EXP-E, MCU and 6 remote SX-20 equipped sites.

projects.title: Cisco Connect conference - November 25th 2014
projects.description:
A new Reality - All Virtual.
One server, 10+ Virtual Machines. Including:
ASA 1000V Cloud Firewall, Nexus 1000v, CSR 1000v, CUCM, CUC, two DNS servers to act as corporate (intranet) and provider (internet) DNS servers, ExpressWay-C, ExpressWay-E (with Certificate Authority self-signed certificates) and the ability to login with jabber softphone through an external connection without a vpn client running and with no initial application setup needed.

projects.title: Topology change migration
projects.description: Network topology change. Necessary configuration changes to move VPN tunnels from the routers to newly installed firewalls in DC and HQ sites. Also, routing changes regarding the VoIP path of the Cisco infrastructure.

projects.title: Data Center implementation
projects.description: Ground-up implementation of a new Data Center, which included a Huawei Quidway 7712 switch, two Huawei AR2204 routers, 30+ servers with 7 ethernet ports per server, LACP support, Layer 2 connectivity with remote offices, two Fortinet Fortigate firewalls, port forwarding for monitoring of UPS, IP Cameras, DVR, temperature.

projects.title: Core Move
projects.description:
"Pick up" and move one of AMS-IX's Core locations in NL.
The scope included migration of the production platform, management network, servers, services, firewalls and border routers etc.
And of course, while making sure there is no impact in peering platform and services

projects.title: Partnership with Epsilon
projects.description:
The project's scope was to perform changes to the AMS-IX USA IXP platform and management networks as well as to technical and commercial operational procedures while making sure everything is as transparent as possible for all customers involved.
Two separate companies and multiple of their respective departments were involved, requiring a high level of communication, detail and planning to effectively complete all tasks in the tight timeframe while resolving  quite tight dependencies.

projects.title: AMS-IX Website project
projects.description: Part of the team responsible for the concept, text copywriting, implementation reviews and releasing phases that handled the re-design, re-organise and re-write of AMS-IX, AMS-IX CW, AMS-IX HK, AMS-IX India and AMS-IX USA websites.

projects.title: Atlassian JIRA implementation as AMS-IX ticketing and project management solution
projects.description:
Worked closely with the consultant/implementer to design workflows, functions and procedures in order to implement/roll out JIRA as the ticketing and project management solution for AMS-IX.
One of the two persons that took over the administration, fine-tuning, composition of manuals/documentation, colleague's training and the escalation point role for any JIRA related issues and/or requests.

contributors.headline: Network Implementation Engineering Manager - Global Network Infrastructure at Google

projects.title: AMS-IX Core switches migration from MLXe-32 to SLX-9850 switches
projects.description:
The first worldwide implementation of SLXes on a live platform.
Planning and execution of a step-by-step procedure to replace AMS-IX Brocade MLXe-32 Core switches (as P switches of an MPLS/VPLS network) with Brocade SLX-9850 switches.

profile_positions.description:
The below are on top of the responsibilities that I perform as NOC Manager (see entry below):
- Participation in project planning, requirements definition and their related solution/proposal reviews for various projects (Agile methodology)
- Responsible for change management and planning of AMS-IX's operations and maintenances.
- Translating organisational strategy and objectives into clear team goals.
- Participating in solution reviews, tests, and vendor discussions.
- Coordinating with vendor's project managers and consultants.
- Working on KPI and SLA definitions and reporting within the ticketing software.
- Facilitating coordination and cooperation between NOC and the rest of AMS-IX's departments with regards to operational issues and features/services enhancements.
- Overseeing and providing guidance for day-to-day operations.
profile_positions.title: Manager Operations

profile_positions.description:
- Management of the Network Operations center, a team of 9 FTEs that ensure proper operation of AMS-IX Internet Exchanges around the globe.
- Responsible for the relation and main point of contact between AMS-IX NOC department and the outsourced first line support (24x7x365).
- Ensuring good communication & interaction between the outsourced first line support and the AMS-IX NOC.
- Overview of all operational projects regarding migrations and new implementations as well as any major network changes in our infrastructure.
- Overview, coordination, and scheduling of all AMS-IX maintenance windows.
- Conducting requirements & RFP documentation.
- Working closely with the System Engineering and Installations Engineering teams regarding new Data Center deployments.
- Projects and tasks planning using Agile methodology.
- Participation in ISO27001 and other audits' (re-)certification process.
- Overview of customer tickets to ensure that the quality of the support provided is according to AMS-IX standards.
- Main JIRA (AMS-IX's ticketing system) administrator for NOC related JIRA projects and one of the administrators team for the projects related to the rest of the departments.
- Escalation point and hands-on participation in day-to-day operations.
profile_positions.title: NOC Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Management of the Engineering department, a team of 4FTEs that ensure proper installations and maintenance of AMS-IX physical infrastructure globally.
- Responsible for the coordination and cooperation of Engineering department with the rest of AMS-IX departments.
- Overview of all operational projects regarding migrations and new implementations.
- Participation in project planning, requirements definition and their related solution/proposal
reviews for various projects (Agile methodology).
profile_positions.title: Engineering Manager (Interim)

profile_positions.description:
- Working on operational tasks (administration, configuration, troubleshooting, feature deployment, expansions etc) on AMS-IX MPLS/VPLS-based (Extreme MLX(e) and SLX series) IXP platforms around the globe .
- Operating the AMS-IX management network, consisting of Dell/Pluribus and older Extreme switches (XMR-4, FGS624P/FGS648P, FCX648, FES2402), Cisco ASR-1001 border routers, and Juniper 550 SRXs.
- Operating GlimmerGlass PXCs (photonic cross connect switches) which provide redundancy to customer connections.
- Participating in on-call shifts to monitor and troubleshoot the exchanges' network and services.
- Organising, coordinating, and performing overnight maintenances (e.g. firmware upgrades, customer migrations/swaps).
- Working closely with Extreme TAC to troubleshoot and root-cause major incidents/bugs.
- Managing, configuring, and troubleshooting customer IPv4/IPv6 BGP sessions on BIRD route servers (~900 ASNs).
- Planning, designing, and executing RFPs, CATs and POCs.
- Projects and tasks planning using Agile methodology.
- JIRA design, implementation, migration, administration, and troubleshooting as AMS-IX's ticketing system.
- Composing technical documentation of technologies, systems, migrations, and procedures to improve team performance and ensure SLAs are met.
- ISO27001 related documentation and certification interviews required to get AMS-IX ISO certified.
- Reviewing customer tickets and ensuring high quality support.
- Providing support and training both to other NOC engineers and to our outsourced FLS team (regarding procedures, monitoring tools, network topology and troubleshooting) and handling escalations/questions.
- Providing direct technical assistance to customers regarding complex technical issues.
- Working with DC engineers on various deployments/installations and on provisioning new and troubleshooting existing backbone and customer links.
profile_positions.title: Network Engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Configuration of network elements (Cisco, Huawei).
- Cisco Unified Call Manager administration and Cisco IP Phones provisioning and deployment.
- Cisco Expressway-C&E administration.
- Remote and/or on-site support to customer regarding network and voice equipment problems.
- Implementation of customer service requests including migrations and/or new features.
- Communication with Cisco TAC engineers regarding customer Trouble Tickets.
profile_positions.title: Network & Voice Engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Monitoring and troubleshooting of Forthnet’s national wide core network (IP, Metro Ethernet, ATM, VoIP), access network (LL, MPLS, VPN, Frame Relay, VoIP) and transmission network (SDH/DWDM NSN TNMS & Huawei iManager U2000, LMDS point-to-multipoint, SRAL point-to-point).
- Management of backbone network Trouble Tickets and Carriers’ communication.
- Troubleshooting Voice backbone network and corporate Voice customer Trouble Tickets (Siemens HiG 1100, HiE 9200 - SS7, VoIP).
- Management, troubleshooting and support xDSL, PCM, Leased-Line & Metro Ethernet related Trouble Tickets for corporate customer (via Siebel eCommunications 6.3 & 7.9).
- DSLAMs monitoring, management, and troubleshooting (Alcatel ISAM DSLAMs via AMS Client, Siemens MSAN DSLAMs via ACI EM GX 2.8M 1.0.53).
- Corporate CPE management (MetaAssist Actelis, ULAF).
- NSN HiT management (7025, 7030, 7060, 7070, 7080).
- Experience in troubleshooting network issues on Juniper and Huawei network elements.
profile_positions.title: Network Engineer

company.name: Special Olympics World Summer Games ATHENS 2011

profile_positions.description:
- Green field implementation of the complete Special Olympics WSG Athens 2011 network.
- Cisco Unified Call Manager Administration (Cisco IP Phones provisioning and deployment).
- Cisco Unity Connection Administration.
- Network monitoring and administration, monitoring tools administration (Hobbit, Cricket, Smokeping, Nagios).
- Tacacs+ configuration (Terminal Access Controller Access-Control System Plus).
- Management of backbone network Trouble Tickets.
- Installation and cabling of servers and network equipment - Structural cabling (PANDUIT certified).
- Management and assignment of the organization’s internal numbering plan, Cosmote Portal and Web2SMS.
- Training of 1st and 2nd level network technicians regarding network topology, configuration, and troubleshooting.
- Technical documentation and SOPs for the 1st and 2nd level network technicians’ training.
- Asset management for Telecommunications equipment.
profile_positions.title: Network & Telecommunications Administrator

company.name: Vivodi Telecom S.A. & ON Telecoms S.A.

profile_positions.company: Vivodi Telecom S.A. & ON Telecoms S.A.
profile_positions.description:
- Monitoring and troubleshooting of Vivodi’s national wide network.
- Management of backbone network Trouble Tickets.
- Troubleshooting of Voice related Trouble Tickets for corporate clients (via BMC Remedy).
- Corporate customer’s xDSL line configuration (Cisco & Ericsson DSLAMs – PEM).
- Retail CPE Management via HDM & VCM (Alcatel Speedtouch 780WL, Vood 452W).
profile_positions.title: Network Operation Center Technician

profile_positions.description:
- Installation, configuration and troubleshooting of corporate workstations and systems.
- Troubleshooting company’s network.
- Monitoring and maintenance of backup process.
- Part of new mail server installation, configuration and migration project.
- Part of the complete rearrangement of both servers and internal cabling project.
- End user training.

profile_positions.description:
